name: Not an "E" Z Bible Quiz | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What bird is not allowed to be eaten, according to Leviticus 11:13, that starts with "E"?
questions.explanation:
eagle.

	The eagle, ossifrage, and osprey are some of the birds considered unclean to eat.

questions.text: What did the Centurion say when there was an earthquake when Jesus was crucified?
questions.correct: Truly this is the Son of God.
options: Holy cow! Did you guys feel that?
This is the Man He claimed to be.
questions.explanation:
Truly this is the Son of God.

	You can read about this in Matthew 27. It said he and the other men with him "feared greatly". Earthquake or earthquakes are mentioned 16 times in the King James Version.

questions.text: Who was the father of Gaal?
questions.explanation:
Ebed.

	Judges 9:26-35  Ebed was a slave. His son Gaal helped revolt against Abimelech.

questions.text: In 1 Samuel 5:1 (KJV), the Philistines took the ark of God and brought it from where to Ashdod?
questions.explanation:
Ebenezer.

	Ebenezer was also the name of the stone in 1 Samuel 7:12. The name means "stone of help".

questions.text: Who is the first person mentioned in the Bible to have gone to Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Abram.

	You can read about this in Genesis 12. Abram went to Egypt because there was a famine in his land.

questions.text: Which one of these men was left-handed?
questions.explanation:
Ehud.

	You can read about Ehud in Judges 3. Judges 3:15 is the verse that mentions he's left-handed. He's also the son of Gera, a Benjamite.

questions.text: Who accused Hannah of being drunk?
questions.explanation:
Eli.

	You can read about this in 1 Samuel 1. Hannah was not drunk, she was praying for a son and although praying silently, her lips were moving.

questions.text: Moses had two sons. One was Gershom; who was the other?
questions.explanation:
Eliezer.

	Exodus 18:4 of the KJV shows us this. His name means "God is help". His mother was Zipporah.

questions.text: Who was the first person in the Bible to bring somebody back from the dead as found in 1 Kings 17 of the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Elijah.

	Elijah stayed with a woman and her son for a while. They were very poor but God made sure they always had enough food. Elijah stretched himself across the boy three times. Each time he asked the Lord to bring back the boy. in verse 23, he brought the boy down to his mother and said "thy son liveth."

questions.text: According to Matthew 1 (KJV) who was the son of Achim's son?
questions.explanation:
Eliud.

	It also says that Eliud was the father of Eleazar. Eliud's name means "God is my praise".
